4 Main Result

To prove TheoremÂ 1.2 we shall show that a smallest counterexample has propertyÂ Î”Î”Delta\Delta. InÂ [4], Dong and Koh extracted the essence of the proofs of ThomassenÂ [7] and JacksonÂ [5] and gave a general method to do this. An important part of that method is the following definition and lemma.

Definition 4.1.

Let Gnormal-Gcaligraphic-G\mathcal{G} be a family of graphs. Gnormal-Gcaligraphic-G\mathcal{G} is called splitting-closed if the following conditions hold for each GâˆˆGğºnormal-Gitalic-G RELOP:element-of caligraphic-GG\in\mathcal{G}.

  • -

    For every complete cut-set Cğ¶italic-CC with |C|â‰¤2ğ¶2VERTBAR:| italic-C VERTBAR:| RELOP:less-than-or-equals NUMBER:2|C|\leq 2, all Cğ¶italic-CC-bridges of Gğºitalic-GG are in ğ’¢ğ’¢caligraphic-G\mathcal{G}.

  • -
